member.name: IWICMetadataQueryReader.GetLocation

summary.para: Retrieves the current path relative to the root metadata block.

param.name: cchMaxLength
param.para: The length of the wzNamespace buffer.

param.name: wzNamespace
param.para: Pointer that receives the current namespace location.

param.name: pcchActualLength
param.para: The actual buffer length that was needed to retrieve the current namespace location.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If you pass NULL to wzNamespace, GetLocation ignores cchMaxLength and returns the required buffer length to store the path in the variable that pcchActualLength points to.
If the query reader is relative to the top of the metadata hierarchy, it will return a single-char string.
If the query reader is relative to a nested metadata block, this method will return the path to the current query reader.

member.name: IWICMetadataQueryReader.GetMetadataByName

summary.para: Retrieves the metadata block or item identified by a metadata query expression.

param.name: wzName
param.para: The query expression to the requested metadata block or item.

param.name: pvarValue
param.para: When this method returns, contains the metadata block or item requested.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: GetMetadataByName uses metadata query expressions to access embedded metadata. For more information on the metadata query language, see the Metadata Query Language Overview.
If multiple blocks or items exist that are expressed by the same query expression, the first metadata block or item found will be returned.

member.name: IWICMetadataQueryReader

summary.para: Exposes methods for retrieving metadata blocks and items from a decoder or its image frames using a metadata query expression.

remarks.para: A metadata query reader uses metadata query expressions to access embedded metadata. For more information on the metadata query language, see the Metadata Query Language Overview.
The benefit of the query reader is the ability to access a metadata item in a single step.

The query reader also provides the way to traverse the whole set of metadata hierarchy with the help of the method. However, it is not recommended to use this method since and provide a more convenient and cheaper way.
